result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Donald A Pickett in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Defendant Donald A Pickett in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Plea/sentencing on 4 files.
State's offer and recommendation:  Plea to charge in 14CF490, mfg/delivery of heroin less than 3 grams; remaining charges to be dismissed and read-in (14CF1640, 14CF1613, 15CF125)
Plea questionnaire filed.  Court colloquy re elements of charges, defendant's rights  and possible penalties.  
Defendant indicates understanding.
Court finds defendant entering plea freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
PLEA - guilty
Finding of guilt.
Defendant waives psi; sentencing to proceed.  Defense counsel has provided additional information to the Court and the State.
Sentencing argument.
Statement by defendant.
BTC: 7 years> 2 yrs incarceration, 5 yrs extended supervision
CFTS
transitional placement 6 months, sober living facility
enroll Racine Vocational Ministry
participate Fatherhood Initiative at YMCA
maintain absolute sobriety; random testing, AODA programming
obtain high school diploma; employment skills, employment
no driving unless properly licensed; work toward obtaining license
costs only
DNA sample and surcharge, 
voting prohibited, 
firearm prohibition; 
eligible for ERP; 
not CIP eligible (aged out)

Joe Kremkoski
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Donald A Pickett in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Donald A Pickett in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: Vacate Warrant  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
